meanings.definition: The quality or state of being deceitful or untrustworthy.
meanings.sent1: Her perfidiousness was evident when she lied about her whereabouts.
meanings.sent2: The perfidiousness of the con artist left many victims in financial ruin.
meanings.sent3: The perfidiousness of the cat pretending to be stuck in a tree was revealed when it chased a bird.
meanings.sent4: The perfidiousness of the storm clouds, promising a sunny day but bringing rain instead, was frustrating.
meanings.sent5: The perfidiousness of the mirror, showing a distorted reflection, made her doubt her appearance.

meanings.sent1: The perfidiousness of his friend, who revealed his secret, hurt deeply.
meanings.sent2: She felt the sting of perfidiousness when her colleague took credit for her work.
meanings.sent3: The perfidiousness of the cookie jar, pretending to be full but actually empty, disappointed the children.
meanings.sent4: The perfidiousness of time, stealing moments of joy and leaving only memories, was bittersweet.
meanings.sent5: The perfidiousness of the GPS, leading them astray with wrong directions, caused them to be lost.
